item.title: [HIVE-8383] FilterAggregateTransposeRule loses conditions that cannot be pushed
item.description: When CBO is turned on, FilterAggregateTransposeRule loses conditions that cannot be pushed, which causes ppd_gby.q, ppd_gby2.q, ppd_gby_join.q's results to be wrong.
item.summary: FilterAggregateTransposeRule loses conditions that cannot be pushed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: related to https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OPTIQ-434. Gunther Hagleitner, we may need to update Calcite that is used in Hive.
the patch for OPTIQ is committed by Julian already.
Fixed in OPTIQ-434

item.title: [HIVE-8384] webhcat jobsubmission fails in secure mode with TimelineClient error
item.description: Webhcat does not get a timelineserver delegation token and as a result it fails in kerberos secure mode with hadoop 2.5 .
item.summary: webhcat jobsubmission fails in secure mode with TimelineClient error

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Relevant portion of the stack trace -

java.io.IOException: org.apache.hadoop.security.authentication.client.AuthenticationException: GSSException: No valid credentials provided (Mechanism level: Failed to find any Kerberos tgt)

YARN-2676 will fix this issue.
Closing as 'not a problem' as the solution is in Yarn.

item.title: [HIVE-8385] UNION Operator in Hive
item.description:
While Hive has UNION ALL feature, it results in duplicate records and customers have to write another complex query or MapReduce job to Dedup the duplicate records. UNION feature is must have in Hive as it is in all SQL RDBMS as well as in Apache Impala.

Not sure how much effort will it take given the fact that UNION ALL is already available.
item.summary: UNION Operator in Hive

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: This issue has been fixed and released as part of the 1.2.0 release. If you find an issue which seems to be related to this one, please create a new jira and link this one with new jira.

item.summary: HCAT api call is case sensitive on fields in struct column

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Looks like the input field name is lowercased before comparison in StructTypeInfo.getStructFieldTypeInfo(), but the actual struct field names are not lowercased during the comparison. So I'm wondering if these field names should have been in lowercase in the first place. Patch will automatically lowercase the struct field names when the StructTypeInfo is created.

Overall: -1 no tests executed

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12673459/HIVE-8386.1.patch

ATTACHMENT ID: 12674245
Test failures do not look related.
Sushanth Sowmyan Alan Gates does this one look ok?

+1.

The change itself looks good to me. As to whether or not AvroSerDe works with HCatFieldSchema, you're not making the matters worse with this patch, since HCatFieldSchema already normalizes(lowercases) it. That can be a separate matter to fix if needed.

Also +cc-ing Eugene Koifman so he's aware of this.

Also, looking at JsonSerDe, that's not affected by HCatFieldSchema lowercasing, since it uses that only for reading, and for writing, takes the types from the appropriate StructObjectInspector passed in to the serialize method for it. If the AvroSerDe behaves similarly, HCatFieldSchema doing the lowercasing should only affect reading, which is good. If not, we need to make that more robust for definitions of case-sensitivity while working with hive.
Vikram Dixit K I would like to add this to 0.14.
Committed to trunk/branch-0.14
Does this need documentation or just a release note?
Release note (if even that). As far as I'm concerned this was just a bug.
Okay, thanks.
This has been fixed in 0.14 release. Please open new jira if you see any issues.

item.title: [HIVE-8388] Support GROUP/ORDER BY column references by ordinal position
item.description:
Allow user to reference the group by or order by column by the desired column's ordinal position

Support syntax such as:

select t.col1, sum(t.col2) from my_table t group by 1 order by 1
item.summary: Support GROUP/ORDER BY column references by ordinal position

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Duplicates HIVE-494.

I see already available with option:
set hive.groupby.orderby.position.alias=true;

Using Hive 0.14 and this option with hortonworks sample file and simple query works
select code, description from sample_07 order by 1;

But with aggregation fails
select max (salary) from sample_07 group by salary order by 1;
Error: Error while compiling statement: FAILED: SemanticException [Error 10004]: Line 1:12 Invalid table alias or column reference 'salary': (possible column names are: _c0) (state=42000,code=10004)

item.title: [HIVE-8389] Fix CBO when indexes are used
item.description: Disable CBO when indexes are used
item.summary: Fix CBO when indexes are used

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: RB https://reviews.apache.org/r/26427/
Doesn't this disable it whenever indexes are enabled at all? They are not necessarily present. So if someone turns this on it will turn CBO completely off
Gunther Hagleitner could you please take a look at Sergey Shelukhin's comments and let me know if my understanding is wrong?

Pengcheng Xiong Sergey is right. This way you'll disable CBO whenever someone turns on the index optimization. That works, but is a blunt way of handling it. I've looked at the code a little bit. Since you can't tell from the semantic analyzer if any indices qualify, they only other way to handle this is to find out why CBO and index optimizer actually conflict and then address that.

Can you share the testcase/result on this ticket that shows the conflict?

ATTACHMENT ID: 12673462

In this patch,

(1) index is enabled for the following test cases in CliDriver: alter_concatenate_indexed_table.q,alter_index.q,authorization_index.q,drop_index_removes_partition_dirs.q,index_auth.q,index_auto.q,index_auto_empty.q,index_auto_file_format.q,index_auto_mult_tables.q,index_auto_mult_tables_compact.q,index_auto_multiple.q,index_auto_multipleX.q,index_auto_partitioned.q,index_auto_self_join.q,index_auto_unused.q,index_auto_update.q,index_bitmap.q,index_bitmap1.q,index_bitmap2.q,index_bitmap3.q,index_bitmap_auto.q,index_bitmap_auto_partitioned.q,index_bitmap_compression.q,index_bitmap_rc.q,index_compact.q,index_compact_1.q,index_compact_2.q,index_compact_3.q,index_compact_binary_search.q,index_compression.q,index_creation.q,index_serde.q,index_stale.q,index_stale_partitioned.q,show_indexes_edge_cases.q,show_indexes_syntax.q,udf_index.q

(2) the "fetch.task.conversion" optimization is disabled for index_auto_partitioned.q and index_bitmap_auto_partitioned.q because it will block index optimizer.

(3) And, index is enabled for ql_rewrite_gbtoidx.q in TestMinimrCliDriver
I think we may change the title to "Enable index when CBO are used".....
Will commit after HiveQA

Overall: -1 at least one tests failed

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12674571/HIVE-8389.2.patch

ERROR: -1 due to 2 failed/errored test(s), 6552 tests executed
Failed tests:

org.apache.hadoop.hive.cli.TestCliDriver.testCliDriver_parallel
org.apache.hadoop.hive.cli.TestNegativeCliDriver.testNegativeCliDriver_set_hiveconf_validation2

Test results: http://ec2-174-129-184-35.compute-1.amazonaws.com/jenkins/job/PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build/1251/testReport
Console output: http://ec2-174-129-184-35.compute-1.amazonaws.com/jenkins/job/PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build/1251/console
Test logs: http://ec2-174-129-184-35.compute-1.amazonaws.com/logs/PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build-1251/

Messages:

Executing org.apache.hive.ptest.execution.PrepPhase
Executing org.apache.hive.ptest.execution.ExecutionPhase
Executing org.apache.hive.ptest.execution.ReportingPhase
Tests exited with: TestsFailedException: 2 tests failed

This message is automatically generated.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12674571
is set_hiveconf_validation2 related?
Yes, it is related. I am fixing it right now.
address test failures
committed to trunk Vikram Dixit K ok for 0.14?

Doc note: This adds the value "none" to configuration parameter hive.fetch.task.conversion so the wiki needs to be updated (with version information):

  • Configuration Properties – hive.fetch.task.conversion

(TODOC## label to follow, pending decision about 0.14.)
Lefty Leverenz, thank you for your comments. I will try to address your concern after I get the permission to write.

Pengcheng Xiong, I don't see a request for wiki edit access on the user@hive mailing list yet. You just need to send your Confluence username:

  • About This Wiki – How to get permission to edit

This is such a simple fix, I could do it for you. But you'll probably need wiki edit access in the future, so you might as well get it now.
Done. Thanks Lefty Leverenz
committed to 14

Doc note: Removed the TODOC14 label now that the "none" value of hive.fetch.task.conversion is documented in the wiki (thanks, Pengcheng Xiong):

  • Configuration Properties – hive.fetch.task.conversion
Hi. After the recent run in HIVE-8395, it looks like most of the tests stopped using indexes again. They worked correctly when I was preparing the updated patch for that run.

True. Previously, for example,
we have predicate: ((UDFToDouble(key) > UDFToDouble(80)) and (UDFToDouble(key) < UDFToDouble(100))),
now we have predicate: ((UDFToDouble(key) > 80.0) and (UDFToDouble(key) < 100.0))
This makes it not work. I will generate a patch soon.
Left a comment in RB. Can you attach patch to JIRA so HiveQA would run?
HIVE-8510 tracks the update
er, HIVE-8501
This has been fixed in 0.14 release. Please open new jira if you see any issues.

item.summary: CBO produces annoying exception message and wraps exceptions too much

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

Update patch to also remove these intermediate exceptions
This might be a little bit of an overkill, but otherwise all this chain will be displayed to the user

https://reviews.apache.org/r/26582/diff/#
Ashutosh Chauhan can you please review?
The patch:
1) Doesn't print exception when column stats are missing; the column stats missing statement is still printed from the callee.
2) Removes some exception wrapping in Hive.
3) Unwraps some wrapping added by Calcite via reflection.
